A Brief Enquiry Into Online Relationships - A 1975 Album Review

By James Bithell

Kirsten Murray explores the musical melting pot that is the 1975's third studio album.

Review: Some Rap Songs - Earl Sweatshirt

Experimental, chaotic and deeply personal - Alex Thompson reviews the brief yet brilliant album from Odd Future affiliate Earl Sweatshirt

Review: Little Mix - LM5

Little Mix return more empowered and more experimental than ever before, writes Andy Tallon

Live Review: Sigrid @ Albert Hall, Manchester - 8/11/18

Sigrid shows up with a high-energy, fiery headline show, writes Andy Tallon

Live Review: Within Temptation @ O2 Academy Birmingham 9/11/18

Within Temptation are absolutely mesmerizing on their latest world tour, writes Helena Senior

Review: Simulation Theory - Muse

Insipid, bland and derivative - Alex Thompson pulls no punches reviewing the latest 80's inspired offering from stadium rockers Muse

Review: Dancing Queen - Cher

Review: SOUL Candy! Milan 1980

Saskia Starritt reviews the eagerly-anticipated event from student favourite Soul Candy

Review: Young and Dangerous - The Struts

The Struts' second studio album hails a new era of rock and roll, writes Helena Senior

Preview: Soul Candy! Milan 1980

Saskia Starritt previews what is expected to be another night of fun, freedom, and expression with Soul Candy

Live Review: Jorja Smith @ Rock City, Nottingham - 14/10/18

In her first headline tour, Jorja Smith captivates with some truly breathtaking performances, writes Andy Tallon

Live Review: MNEK @ Gorilla, Manchester - 8/10/18

MNEK dominates in a storming debut headline show

Live Review: Catherine McGrath @ The Wardrobe, Leeds - 23/9/18

Andy Tallon reviews the headline tour of up-and-coming country star Catherine McGrath

Review: Joy as an Act of Resistance - Idles

Beth Colquhoun gives her verdict on the latest work from Bristolian rockers Idles

Review: Bloom - Troye Sivan

On his second album 'Bloom', Troye Sivan demonstrates himself to be deserving of pop superstardom, writes Andy Tallon

The summer of Kanye

Abdullah Hussain takes you through the best track from each new album involving Kanye West this summer

Review: Sweetener - Ariana Grande

In the wake of a difficult year, Ariana Grande offers something unexpected with her long-awaited fourth album, writes Andy Tallon

Review: Palo Santo - Years & Years

Years and Years have made their long-awaited return with a record that's more honest and more bold than ever before, writes Andy Tallon

Review: Lost & Found - Jorja Smith

Jorja Smith exceeds expectations with a classy debut, writes Andy Tallon

On & On: Summer Carnival Review

The party spirit was rejuvenated with the grooves and blues that were brought by York party royalty, On & On.

Review: Good Thing - Leon Bridges

Rising soul star Leon Bridges shows his talent, but there's still better to come from him, writes Andrew Young

Review: Resistance is Futile - Manic Street Preachers

Andrew Young assesses the latest effort from the Welsh rockers

Soul Candy: Copacabana

Copacabana comes to York as Soul Candy host a night to remember.

On & On: The Temple of Groove

ONE DAY ONLY: Northern Youth's Latest Event

On February 19th, The Northern Youth hosted their latest event, "ONE DAY ONLY", a pop-up shop and after-party in Orillo Studios. The night was a success, and made over PS700.

Album Review: First Aid Kit - Ruins

Andrew Young discusses a strong fourth album from the Swedish sisters

On & On: Festival of Light

The party keeps going 'On & On'.

Album Review: Charli XCX - Pop 2

Emily Taylor discusses Charlie XCX's pop revolution.

DROP

2017 Advent Calandar

The music writers look back at some of the best albums of the year.
